meanings.definition: Having or showing an excessively high opinion of one's appearance, abilities, or worth.
meanings.sent1: She was vainer than a peacock, always admiring herself in the mirror.
meanings.sent2: He became vainer as he received more compliments on his new haircut.
meanings.sent3: The vainer she got, the less her friends wanted to spend time with her.
meanings.sent4: Her vanity made her vainer than a movie star on the red carpet.
meanings.sent5: His vainer attitude made him believe he was the best at everything.

meanings.definition: In a way that is futile or pointless.
meanings.sent1: She tried vainer to fix the broken toy, but it was beyond repair.
meanings.sent2: He searched vainer for his lost keys in the dark alley.
meanings.sent3: Running vainer, he missed the last train home.
meanings.sent4: She shouted vainer into the wind, hoping someone would hear her.
meanings.sent5: The detective looked vainer for clues in the empty room.

meanings.definition: More worthless or futile than something else.
meanings.sent1: The old phone was vainer compared to the new model.
meanings.sent2: His excuses were vainer than a broken umbrella in a storm.
meanings.sent3: The plan to sneak out was vainer than a chocolate teapot.
meanings.sent4: Her efforts seemed vainer as the project deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The fake jewelry looked vainer next to the real diamonds.
